titles.title: To allow the marketing of the Sensor Pad a medical device to aid in breast self-examination.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health and Environment.

bill.summary: 12/7/1995--Introduced. Considers a specified medical device to aid in breast self-examination to be a device for which a report required under the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act prior to introduction into interstate commerce for commercial distribution has been accepted by the Secretary of Health and Human Services and which has been approved under such Act.
